title: Weekly Viz 2024-08-18(W33)
text:
This week’s visulization is a recation of blog post by Dr. Aditya Dahiya.
During the process of creating this week’s viz, I learned how to use R Studio and the basics of data wragling with tidyverse, which led me to discover Quarto, resulting in my current blog system.
What a wonderful journey it has been, it all started with a simple glance at Dr. Aditya Dahiya’s blog. R is so fascinating; I will definitely continue to dive deeper into it.

title: Weekly Viz 2024-08-18(W33)
Weekly Viz 2024-08-18(W33)
text:
Thoughts About Tableau Viz Extension
Although the Tableau Viz Extension is a significant feature of Tableau released recently, I found that there are still some areas for improvement. For instance:

The flexibility of Chart Format is relatively low, especially in the Level Label, where you cannot adjust its position to both outside which is quite common in Sankey chart, and the font colors are not consistent in color palette, some are black, some are white.
Currently, only Tableau’s own Sankey Extension supports publishing to Tableau Public.
While there are some third-party extensions available, but many require purchase, and I haven’t tested whether I can publish them to Tableau Server yet.

Therefore, I personally think that while the Tableau Viz Extension looks promising, Tableau still have a lot of work to do. I will continue to keep an eye on it.

title: Weekly Viz 2024-08-18(W33)

References

A good material to learn R, and it is open sourced on Github.

title: Weekly Viz 2024-08-11(W32)
text: This week’s visulization is from Workout Wednesday challenge W32.

title: Weekly Viz 2024-08-11(W32)
text:
Dataset
The original dataset is from kaggle.

This is a historical dataset on the modern Olympic Games, including all the Games from Athens 1896 to Rio 2016. I scraped this data from www.sports-reference.com in May 2018. The R code I used to scrape and wrangle the data is on GitHub. I recommend checking my kernel before starting your own analysis.

But the challenge use a cleaned Excel file.

This challenge uses data from 1896-2016 Summer Olympics. You can find it here on Google Drive.

title: Weekly Viz 2024-08-11(W32)
text:
Takeaway

Use INT((INDEX()-1)/5) and table calculation to distribute rows

need to pay attention to specific dimensions used by the table calculation

Plain string concat STR(FIXED_LOD) as dimensions
Use IIF([Medal] = 'Gold', 'GOLD', NULL) function to simplify IF THEN END expresion
Reference line fill above according to the parameter
Edit Axis with custom range
Tooltip formatting(font family, font size, colors)

Learned about a new font Trebuchet MS

Set Dashboard title
